name: Modern Languages (French and Spanish)
aboutCourse:
This course is run at St Catherine's College and trains candidates in KS3 & 4.
Candidates will be on a 50% timetable with 4 days in school and 1 day at Sussex University.
Candidates will be regularly watched by their mentor to ensure that they are succeeding on the course.
There will be a second, contrasting placement at a school which is mutually agreed.
interviewProcess: Candidates will be required to teach a small group of students for approximately 20 minutes, to judge their aptitude to teach. This will be followed by a formal interview.
howSchoolPlacementsWork:
The age range of students is 11 to 16 years

The candidate will have a total of two placements
The second placement is approx 6 weeks
personalQualities:
We are looking for an enthusiastic person with a passion for their subject and the development of young people. Candidates need to be well organised and willing to get fully involved in the life of the department and the school. They need to be creative, innovative and interested in all aspects of their subject and of pastoral care as a tutor.
Candidates must be willing to take risks in their teaching and be able to adapt to change and innovation.
Are you ready to take the challenge?
otherRequirements: Satisfactorily pass DBS and Health checks
